page.title: 15JEWISH CEMETERY
page.content: Since opening in 1960 there have been 10,000 burials.There are about 500 bodies buried per year.Of all the 10,000 the oldest is 100 years old,the youngest is a still born child.Jewish dead are buried on the same day as death,if possible before sunset.The Rabbi said"he had been working at the cemetery since it opened".He employs 8 men and 1 woman of all faiths and has enough land left for 20 years of burials.On June 7 1985 a monument to the 6 million jews killed in Nazi Germany was consecrated by the Chief Rabbi of Great Britain,Sir Immanuel Jacobovitz.The monument is made of granite and has 2 Hebrew inscriptions. One on top saying"remember"and one on the stone saying"for those I weep".
